physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: 35.9°C, Blood pressure: 117/68 mm Hg, Pulse: 104 bpm, Respiratory rate: 18 breaths per minute
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The abdomen was gravid, soft, and nontender, with active fetal movements. Fetal heart-rate tracing was reassuring. No peripheral edema or abdominal tenderness; reflexes were normal.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Temperature: 38.9°C, Vital signs normal on follow-up examination
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient had neck and back pain, occipital headache, and vomiting. Back tenderness was noted. Urinalysis was abnormal with yellow, cloudy urine.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Capillary glucose: 111 mg per deciliter (6.2 mmol per liter)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI of the head showed multiple small hyperintense lesions consistent with infarcts.
Occipital headache rated 9 out of 10; no acute change in vision, but presence of floaters and binocular horizontal diplopia.
Echocardiography showed hyperkinetic left ventricle and aneurysmal right ventricular apex.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: New findings compared to previous echocardiogram.
